Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.helper

Class BaseComparatorHelper<X>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.helper.BaseHelper<X>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.helper.BaseComparatorHelper<X>
Type Parameters:
X - The type of elements to be compared.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Helper<X>, Instrument, NonComparableHelper<X>, AutoCloseable, Comparator<X>
Direct Known Subclasses:
InstrumentedComparatorHelper
public abstract class BaseComparatorHelper<X> extends BaseHelper<X> implements NonComparableHelper<X>
Abstract class that extends from BaseHelper and implements NonComparableHelper to provide additional functionality for handling comparisons of elements of type X using a specified Comparator. It is intended to be used as a base class for helpers that perform sorting or similar operations relying on comparison logic.

    • BaseComparatorHelper

      public BaseComparatorHelper(String description, Comparator<X> comparator, int n, Random random, Instrument instrumenter, Config config)
      Constructor for explicit random number generator.
      Parameters:
      description - the description of this Helper (for humans).
      comparator - the Comparator of X to be used.
      n - the number of elements expected to be sorted. The field n is mutable so can be set after the constructor.
      random - a random number generator.
      instrumenter - an instance of Instrument.
      config - the configuration to be used.

    • clone

      public Helper<X> clone(String description, Comparator<X> comparator, int N)
      Creates and returns a clone of the Helper with the specified configuration. This implementation always throws SortException.
      Specified by:
      clone in interface Helper<X>
      Parameters:
      description - a description of the Helper.
      comparator - the Comparator of type X to be used for comparisons.
      N - the number of elements expected to be sorted.
      Returns:
      a cloned instance of Helper parameterized with type X.
      Throws:
      SortException - if the operation is not implementable.
